[10.11]-1 
City of Gresham Development Code 
 
(01/23) 
 
SECTION 10.1100 
SHORELINE HEIGHT STANDARDS 
General 
10.1101  Purpose 
10.1102  Application 
 
General 
10.1101  Purpose 
The purpose of the shoreline height standards is to reduce the visual impact of structures built between the south 
bank of the Columbia River and Marine Drive. 
10.1102  Application 
The following height limits shall apply to structures for which a development permit is required on land lying 
north of Marine Drive: 
A. 
New structures shall not exceed a height equivalent to an elevation of three feet above the elevation of 
that portion of the Marine Drive roadway which abuts the development site. 
B. 
Enlargements to existing dwellings and construction of residential accessory structures on the same lot 
as an existing dwelling shall be permitted with a maximum height of 45 feet above grade. 
Shoreline height standards do not apply to affordable housing development under Section 10.1700.
